textString: THE WIND RISES The wind is rising!
I want to pick bamboo grass.
You promised to go with me.
He's a famous Italian aircraft designer.
I better put some iodine on it.
Big brother, what are you doing?
Focusing on the stars should improve my eyesight.
I think this is my dream.
This is my dream, you know.
You think we are sharing this dream?
I'm very glad to meet you.
They will bomb the enemy city.
But the war will soon be over.
When the war is over, I will build this.
Instead of bombs, she'll carry passengers.
Of course we can't climb up here...
You can walk along the spar.
She'll carry a hundred people across the Atlantic.
Do you think I could design airplanes?
I don't even know how to fly.
But I am a creator of airplanes.
Airplanes are not tools for war.
They are not for making money.
Jiro, you should go to bed.
I heard you talking to someone.
Mother, I'm going to be an aeronautical engineer.
I want to design beautiful airplanes.
You picked a great day to come back.
The whole east side is burning.
They'll never stop the fire now.
Is the wind still rising, Japanese boy?
Then you must live. "Le vent se lève."
All the new buildings are old-fashioned.
The Western powers are building all-metal aircraft.
We're more than ten years behind.
You eat mackerel to look at the bones?
The NACA has a standard curve just like this bone.
A lady brought this for you, sir.
You were out, so she left it with me.
I'll tell them I kept you.
Come on, it's been two years.
Didn't you try to see her again?
The fire stopped at her street.
I never dreamed Tokyo would recover so quickly.
Can I stay with you, Jiro?
Father won't let me live here by myself.
I'll probably be in Nagoya by the time you come.
I want to study medicine in Tokyo.
I think you might be a good one.
I'll talk to Father next time I'm home.
They must've been heading for the city.
There's no work in the countryside.
Which one is it this time?
I was told to come anytime in April.
Then you should've come in March!
I've got an assignment for you.
It's the design for the wing strut fitting.
It's imported, but no one likes it.
The Falcon Project has a new engineer.
He's the genius we've all been hearing about.
- Yes, I'd like to take a look.
Asking a green engineer to design that fitting is practically hazing.
Sorry to bother you on your break.
You young engineers should visit us more often.
Is his fitting better than yours?
Kurokawa's always hard on new employees.
Honjo, get up here and take a look.
Maybe they are, but we're late.
The strut fitting for the Falcon.
This leaf spring will absorb stress from the wing.
The wire expands and contracts automatically.
It runs through the strut to an anchor on the fuselage.
But we'd have to redesign the wing!
I haven't done the calculations yet.
Where's the assignment I gave you?
That looks like a very clean design to me.
Submit your work as soon as you finish!
They haul prototypes to the airfield.
The latest aircraft, hauled by oxen.
Kurokawa, we'll investigate the cause when the weather clears.
Do you think the strut fitting failed?
I think the problem is deeper and more complicated.
I'll never forget what I saw today.
It's like an endless road is opening up before my eyes.
There won't be a Falcon Two.
The Army has decided to go with a competing design.
Today was our last chance to change their minds.
We're going to build a bomber with help from Junkers.
This is your chance to see Germany.
I feel bad closing the place up.
You have some strange eating habits.
Did you think she was going to smile and say thank you?
There are dozens of hungry kids right here in this neighborhood.
The cost of one fitting would feed that kid's family for a month.
Jiro, do you know what we're paying the Germans for their technology?
Enough to feed every kid in Japan, with sponge cake for dessert.
Still, I plan to make the most of this opportunity.
So they pay us a lot to design them.
To work hard at the office, you need a family at home.
The airstrip's next to the plant.
Who's the Army planning to bomb with this thing?
Passengers can sit in the wings.
This would be wasted as a bomber.
We need their all-metal airframe technology.
Is this how Germans treat their guests?
Japan has lots of planes like this.
We have a license to your technology.
We have the right to be here.
Your bosses never said we couldn't inspect this airplane.
I'm sure you're only trying to do your job...
but we won't tolerate this treatment.
Our orders were not to let you Japanese wander around.
I'm surprised we got a demonstration.
There's more vibration than I expected.
Let the Army officers sit here.
This is truly a stupendous aircraft.
Look, a corridor through the wing.
It's like being inside a power plant.
Please show us your work station.
This is the flight engineer's station.
A triumph of German industrial technology.
Junkers is my hero, but his company is sneaky.
It looks cold outside, but this room is cozy.
This almost looks like that plane.
You think we'll never figure out all-metal construction on our own?
We can't learn anything from this.
Maybe we don't even need their technology.
Wood and canvas could be as good as metal.
We're Achilles, chasing a tortoise with a twenty-year lead.
If we close the gap in five years...
he'll be five more years down the road.
Someday we'll overtake him and move ahead.
I wonder if we can be the tortoise.
- We saw him in the hangar.
with a face like he's carrying the future of Japanese aviation.
Some of us are returning immediately.
Jiro will continue west and return to Japan.
- They want him to see the world.
Then I invite you to join me on my final flight.
There's a hatch under the fuselage.
before we deliver this bomber to the Air Force.
It's like a building out of ancient Rome.
This plane is too large to be used for war...
but the Air Force likes everything big.
We could never build something like this.
The important thing for an engineer is inspiration.
This may be a dream, but you can still lose your head.
Which would you choose, a world with pyramids or one without them?
Humanity dreams of flight, but the dream is cursed.
Aircraft are destined to become tools for slaughter and destruction.
But still, I chose a world with pyramids in it.
I want to create beautiful airplanes.
I have a long way to go.
I don't even have the engine yet.
Artists are only creative for ten years.
Live your ten years to the full.
How long have you been with us, Jiro?
We want you to lead the project.
It's the Navy's design competition for 1932.
I'd like Honjo on the team.
We've got other plans for Honjo.
And damn this short flight deck.
Father, I'm afraid I was rude to that man.
You'll have a chance to say thank you.
Just that man who caught the parasol.
He seems to be here by himself.
I was giving thanks to the spring.
I asked it to bring you here, to me.
You're just like you were then.
We were so grateful for your help after the earthquake.
I wanted to see you again and thank you.
Kinu got married two days after she dropped off your shirt.
She cried for joy when we found you.
You were our knight in shining armor.
You were like a knight on a white horse that day.
She just had her second child.
I'll keep it this way in honor of today.
I'd almost forgotten what rainbows look like.
I'm afraid my daughter has caused you trouble again.
The same thing happened to me.
The Nazis are a gang of hoodlums.
A good place to forget bad things.
Make a puppet state in Manchuria.
- Will Germany go to war again?
I'm sorry to keep you waiting so long.
I'm afraid we'll have to cancel our dinner plans.
Please tell her I hope she feels better.
The doctor will be here soon.
"But when the leaves hang trembling, the wind is passing through."
Is the young lady feeling better?
At first, this young man was very gloomy.
You will go down the mountain.
You will forget what happened here.
This person you're talking about wouldn't be my daughter, would it?
But first, there's something I have to tell you.
Two years ago, my mother died of tuberculosis.
I've loved you since that day you rescued my hat.
I've loved you since the wind brought you to me.
But I want to get well first.
Even if it takes a hundred years.
He is a nice young man.
But we won't know until she flies.
My plane was just a tin duckling.
I have an idea for you.
Use flathead screws on the access hatches.
Maintenance will be easy with a hinge on one side.
A spring about this stiff should be fine.
That's a great idea, like Columbus and his egg.
After you use it, I'll use it too.
The Special Police are looking for you.
I told them you were away on business.
They arrested some of my friends.
Wish we'd had it last year.
Our next plane will be a full-grown duck, not a duckling.
Better lie low for a few days.
Let me stop by my apartment.
The police will be opening your mail.
Such things shouldn't happen in a modern country.
You think Japan's a modern country?
The police are waiting for you.
Let them read your love letters.
The Navy's next design competition is in your hands.
That is, as long as you're useful.
Just keep your mind on work.
Why are they looking for him?
I pray that he managed to leave Japan safely.
What's the fastest way to get to Tokyo?
I have to be there as soon as possible.
If you take the noon bus, you can catch the express.
I'll send someone to hold the bus for you.
I wish I could've come sooner.
Father, Jiro came to see me.
But he has to leave right away.
- Next time I'll use the front door.
- Use the garden, it's more fun.
I wish I could look after her.
The way to do that is to focus on your work.
I'm going to the sanatorium the doctor recommended.
I want a life with Jiro.
So I gave up on that idea.
The next design uses all the latest technology.
I thought the Navy requested 220 knots.
Wing loading is 120 kilos per square meter.
We'll minimize drag and push the limits of technology.
She'll have split flaps and leading edge slats.
But then weight becomes a problem.
If we leave out the guns, we should be okay.
I decided to set this idea aside for now.
To compensate, we need a light, strong structure.
We'll cut excess weight and minimize drag with a smooth skin.
We're going to build an all-metal fighter...
like nothing the world's ever seen.
He's going to tell us about the new rivets.
It's technically possible to build strong structures with flush rivets.
We're going to skin the whole aircraft with flush rivets.
I must say, that was interesting.
I worried I wouldn't find you.
I just had to see you.
We've come to you with a request.
but I can hardly approve of an unmarried couple living together.
Nahoko was very brave to leave the sanatorium.
The bride and I have preparations to make.
Don't worry, he's always like that.
If you care about her, you'll send her back immediately.
I'd have to give up my work.
Is that your heart or your ego talking?
This lovely maiden has traveled far to join her beloved.
She's given up everything in the world for him.
This man is an insensitive simpleton...
without a home of his own.
If that's... uh, okay with you, please come in.
Then they shall exchange the marriage vows.
No words can express our gratitude for your kindness.
We will never forget our debt to you.
Come now, we're delighted that Jiro's found such a wonderful partner.
Do you always get home this late?
I came on behalf of the family to thank the Kurokawas.
What are you going to do?
She's alone in that room all day.
Her condition is much worse than you think.
Did you notice she uses rouge every morning so you won't worry?
How can you do this to her?
Does she really have to stay here?
Each day is very precious to us now.
I'm glad you came to visit.
She's like the sun, with such a bright future.
She said next time, she'll come as my doctor.
And your mother made me a chemise and a nightgown.
I have to finish the design by tomorrow.
I think it could be a little lighter.
I like to look at you while you work.
In a one-handed slide rule contest, I'd win first prize for sure.
I think I can make each rib half an ounce lighter.
Thirty ribs makes about a pound.
Half a pound is enough for two.
I could eat a pound of mackerel by myself.
Can I let go for a minute?
This design is you, right down to the mackerel bones.
Jiro, let me use flush rivets too.
Yeah, but they're only letting me modify the fuselage.
That's where the fuel tanks are.
To save weight, we're not even shielding the fuel tanks.
She's got to fly 3,000 kilometers with a big payload.
More horsepower alone won't be enough.
Who are they going to fight?
We just want to build good aircraft.
Now we'll see how she flies.
She's on her way to the field.
I'll probably spend a few nights there.
I'm sure it will fly beautifully.
I couldn't have done it without you.
Just be careful not to tire yourself.
I'll straighten up when I get back.
We shouldn't do anything until her train leaves.
She wants him to remember her as she was.
Just think, that's one of ours.
Sorry, the numbers are too high.
This is where we first met.
Or the land of the dead.
Those ten years in the sun, did you live them to the full?
Things fell apart toward the end, though.
That's what it means to lose a war.
There was nothing to come back to.
waiting for the sky to swallow them up.
She's been waiting here for a long time.
She was beautiful, like the wind.
First, shall we drop by my house?

A Tribute to Jiro Horikoshi and Tatsuo Hori Voices Hideaki Anno Miori Takimoto A white sloping path Runs up into the sky A gently swaying, misy haze Surrounding and holding Unnoticed by anyone, all alone Soaring upwards Not afraid of anything Dancing up Longing to be in the sky Speeding through the sky A whole life, a vapor trail Even before dying From that window, up high Watching the sky Now no one understands No one would understand All they could think was... "Too young" Yet... happy Longing to be in the sky Speeding through the sky A whole life, a vapor trail Longing to be in the sky Speeding through the sky A whole life, a vapor trail Theme Song Yumi Arai Music Joe Hisaishi Dialogue Translation by Jim Hubbert & Rieko Izutsu-Vajirasarn Subtitles by Aura Executive Producer Koji Hoshino Producer Toshio Suzuki A Studio Ghibli Film Original Story and Screenplay Written and Directed by Hayao Miyazaki The End
